personas.label: The Morning Minimalist
personas.description: Lives alone or with a partner and values calm mornings above everything else. Wants quality coffee without complexity — the fewer steps, the better.
goals: Find a machine that delivers great coffee quickly
Simplify the morning routine to one reliable ritual
Learn just enough technique to be consistent
pain_points: Overwhelmed by espresso jargon and technique culture
Frustrated when machines require long warm-up times
Doesn't want to spend weekends dialing in a grinder
personas.hero_subtext: The Arco Primo is built for people who want quality without complexity. Heat up in 90 seconds, pull a beautiful shot, and start your day.

personas.label: The Upgrader
personas.description: Has been making espresso for a while with entry-level equipment and is getting frustrated with inconsistency. Ready to invest in something better and wants to understand what the next step actually looks like.
goals: Understand the real difference between entry and mid-range gear
Make a confident purchase decision with clear comparisons
Improve shot consistency and learn intermediate techniques
pain_points: Can't tell if the problem is the machine, the grinder, or the technique
Overwhelmed by options and conflicting advice online
Worried about spending too much or too little
personas.hero_subtext: You've outgrown your first machine. The Arco Doppio gives you dual-boiler precision without the learning cliff — real performance, approachable controls.

personas.label: The Craft Barista
personas.description: Follows the World Barista Championship, knows what extraction yield means, and has opinions about water chemistry. Wants professional-grade equipment at home and content that respects their knowledge level.
goals: Access pro-level equipment designed for home use
Push technique boundaries with pressure profiling and flow control
Connect with content that matches an advanced skill level
pain_points: Most home equipment is dumbed down and lacks real control
Tired of beginner-level content that wastes their time
Wants detailed specs, not marketing fluff
personas.hero_subtext: The Arco Studio Pro puts pressure profiling, PID temperature control, and competition-grade build quality on your kitchen counter. No compromises.

personas.label: The Traveller
personas.description: Digital nomad, outdoor enthusiast, or frequent flyer who refuses to compromise on coffee quality just because they're not at home. Compactness, portability, and durability are non-negotiable.
goals: Find portable equipment that makes real espresso anywhere
Discover coffee destinations and travel-friendly brewing methods
Build a compact kit that fits in a carry-on or backpack
pain_points: Most portable espresso solutions taste like compromise
Hard to find travel-specific coffee content that isn't about instant coffee
Frustrated by gear that's too fragile for real travel
personas.hero_subtext: The Arco Viaggio weighs 340g and pulls genuine espresso from a mountain ledge, a hotel room, or a campervan. No electricity required.

personas.label: The Non-Barista
personas.description: Wants excellent coffee every single time but has zero interest in the process. Probably switching from capsules or pods and wants something that handles the complexity automatically.
goals: Get café-quality coffee at home with minimal effort
Stop spending money on capsules without downgrading taste
Find a machine that requires almost no technique
pain_points: Intimidated by grinders, tamping, and manual machines
Afraid of buying an expensive machine they can't use properly
Doesn't want to feel judged by coffee snobs
personas.hero_subtext: The Arco Automatico grinds, tamps, and brews with one touch. Specialty-grade espresso without the learning curve.

personas.label: The Office Manager
personas.description: Responsible for their team's coffee setup and focused on reliability, total cost of ownership, and keeping everyone happy. Needs equipment that handles volume without constant maintenance.
goals: Find a reliable machine that handles 30+ cups per day
Justify the investment with clear ROI against capsule or vending costs
Minimize maintenance overhead and service disruptions
pain_points: Previous office machines broke down constantly
Hard to find equipment designed for office volume at a reasonable price
Nobody in the office wants to be responsible for a complicated machine
personas.hero_message: Office coffee that people actually look forward to.
personas.hero_subtext: The Arco Ufficio is built for teams — high-volume, easy to maintain, and it pays for itself in under six months versus capsules.
